meanings.sent1: Grandma vaticinates the weather by looking at the clouds.
meanings.sent2: The fortune teller vaticinates the future for her clients.
meanings.sent3: The cat vaticinates that it will rain by staring at the window.
meanings.sent4: His accurate vaticinates about the stock market amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The old book vaticinates the rise of a great leader in its pages.

meanings.sent1: The wise owl vaticinates danger in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: She vaticinates the outcome of the game based on the players' skills.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel vaticinates a nut falling from the tree before it happens.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact vaticinates the fall of an empire in its inscription.
meanings.sent5: His dream vaticinates a joyful event that will soon come true.

meanings.definition: Speaks or writes as a prophet
meanings.sent1: The poet vaticinates about love and loss in his verses.
meanings.sent2: The oracle vaticinates the fate of the kingdom to the royal family.
meanings.sent3: The parrot vaticinates the arrival of guests by mimicking the doorbell.
meanings.sent4: The ancient scroll vaticinates the birth of a savior in a distant land.
meanings.sent5: Her song vaticinates peace and harmony in a troubled world.
